pr_title: Improve code coverage for Azure Certificates

timeline.message: Improve code coverage for Azure Certificates

timeline.bodyText: We prefer to use all the explicit imports for our SDKs instead of the asterisk(*) notation.
timeline.author: vcolin7
vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: I would rename this to listPropertiesOfCertificates since that is the method name being called.
timeline.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: Please refer to my comments on CertificateClient on the naming this method and listPropertyOfCertificates.
timeline.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: I don't know if we need different runners for overloads of the same method if they do the same thing. I guess it's ok to leave it as is but may be a good thing to consider in a future revision.
timeline.author: vcolin7

timeline.bodyText: We probably should simulate an actual scenario like firing the creation of a certificate and then cancelling the operation like the above method does. Of course, in this case we would use the cancelCertificateOperation method instead of cancelling through the poller just like you did here.
timeline.author: vcolin7

timeline.message: fix: fix checkstyle in Azure Certificate

timeline.author: vcolin7
vcolin7
vcolin7
vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Also, please refer to this comment about the implementation of this test case.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: vcolin7

timeline.message: fix Azure Certificate previous naming issue & removed cancel certificate method
